Title: Head Of Product (Founding Team)
Description:
Head of Product (Founding Team)

Stealth Startup

I’m seeking a head of product for a new venture I’m launching to enable 50MM+ expert-knowledge workers to more easily engage in fractional work. I’m a serial founder and part of a small team that is incubating new ventures. Prior to our current work, we have built two companies from PPT to acquisition. Prior companies were backed by top venture funds and we have commitments from former investors to back this new business.

The startup I’m launching supports expert-level knowledge workers who want to do some form of fractional work – either on-the-side or full-time. There are 20M expert-level knowledge workers already engaged in this type of work, but a much bigger market of them who want in but struggle to get started. Existing gig economy infrastructure and SaaS products don’t address the unique needs of this market. My prior startups include freelance marketplaces and SaaS for freelancers, and I see an opportunity to build a very different company in this huge market. We’ve built an early product with strong user feedback, and we have a clear point of view on the product we need to build for scale. I’m now building a team to bring this to market.

I’m looking for a world-class product leader to join the founding team who fits this description:


8+ years professional experience; 4+ in product design or product strategy
Experience building SaaS products with product-led growth, ideally having owned design from zero to one
Strong User Experience background with the ability to build end-to-end user experienced with for complex systems
Strong User Interface design background; ability to own full UI design of a responsive web app in Figma
Demonstrated evidence of being able to excel as a product leader; capable of working directly with engineering
Lots of startup experience - you’ve been a part of early stage startups – perhaps on the founding team before – and you love the zero to one startup culture and ambiguity.
Deep focus on the customer - Plenty of evidence of working backwards from customer needs, diving deep into market and customer research to understand what to build and what to adjust.
World-class communicator - You communicate incredibly well both verbally and in writing. You take pride in how you communicate and this is one of your superpowers.


If this sounds like you, please get in touch with me! Share your background and I'll reach out. Thank you for reading!

Title: VP of Product Management
Description:
Stellar Cyber is a fast-growing Cybersecurity company focused on delivering holistic cyberattack protection to organizations while significantly reducing total costs of ownership with its innovative Open XDR (eXtended Detection and Response) platform based on advanced ML and security technologies. Stellar Cyber has been recognized by Gartner as one of the leading XDR players.

To accelerate our growth, we are seeking a talented VP of Product Management with startup passion, a can-do attitude, and a desire to make an impact, while building a future for themselves and Stellar Cyber. If you are excited to be part of a very fast-growing team with lots of opportunities, Stellar Cyber is a great place to grow your career. are seeking a dynamic and entrepreneurial Vice President of Product Management to lead our product strategy and product execution, as well as drive innovation in our fast-paced environment. As a foundational member of the executive leadership team, you will have a pivotal role in owning our product roadmap and ensuring we deliver cutting-edge solutions to our customers. This role reports directly to the CEO and will work with them directly on product and positioning strategy. This role will interface across all facets of the business as well as with customers and users. It is critical that the candidate have experience in Security and can drive a product vision of a prescriptive, easy to use platform for both Managed Security Service Providers and Enterprises alike.

Responsibilities


Strategic Product Vision:
Own, develop, and articulate a compelling product vision that aligns with the startup's mission and adapts to the evolving needs of the cybersecurity market
Stay at the forefront of industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitive developments to position our products as leaders in the market
Agile Product Development:
Drive an agile product development process directly with VP of Engineering, iterating quickly and efficiently to deliver innovative solutions to market
Foster a culture of experimentation and rapid prototyping to accelerate the product development cycle
Customer and User Feedback:
Work directly with customers and users to get feedback, iterate on ideas, and build trust
Build a culture where engineers, designers, and product managers are constantly getting in front of customers to learn, get feedback, and validate designs
Cross-functional Collaboration:
Work closely with cross-functional teams including engineering, design, sales, and marketing to ensure alignment and seamless execution of product strategies
Act as a bridge between product management and other functions, facilitating effective communication and collaboration
Market Disruption and Innovation:
Identify and capitalize on opportunities for disruptive innovation within the cybersecurity landscape
Champion a customer-centric approach, utilizing customer feedback and market insights to inform product decisions
Team Leadership and Development:
Build and lead a high-performing product management team, instilling a culture of innovation, accountability, and adaptability
Provide mentorship and growth opportunities for team members to maximize their potential

Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field (MBA is a plus)
10+ years of experience in product management, ideally in startup environments or fast-paced tech companies
Proven track record of successfully launching and growing products in early-stage or high-growth startups
Deep understanding of cybersecurity technologies, threats, and market trends
Entrepreneurial mindset with a bias for action and an ability to thrive in a dynamic, evolving environment
Outstanding communication and leadership skills, with a collaborative and team-oriented approach

Title: Product Owner, Employee Experience
Description:
About Pinterest:

Millions of people across the world come to Pinterest to find new ideas every day. It’s where they get inspiration, dream about new possibilities and plan for what matters most. Our mission is to help those people find their inspiration and create a life they love. In your role, you’ll be challenged to take on work that upholds this mission and pushes Pinterest forward. You’ll grow as a person and leader in your field, all the while helping Pinners make their lives better in the positive corner of the internet.

Creating a life you love also means finding a career that celebrates the unique perspectives and experiences that you bring. As you read through the expectations of the position, consider how your skills and experiences may complement the responsibilities of the role. We encourage you to think through your relevant and transferable skills from prior experiences.

Our new progressive work model is called PinFlex, a term that’s uniquely Pinterest to describe our flexible approach to living and working. Visit our PinFlex landing page to learn more.

Are you passionate about employee experience and designing impactful solutions for employees? Come join the IT Employee Experience team at Pinterest where we have the responsibility for creating the future of our employee experience.

What You’ll Do:


Inspire and partner with cross-functional teams to build People Technology solutions and lead digital transformation by example
Collaboratively draft and define experiences for our people, solving problems and meeting employees needs across the employee lifecycle
Expertise in translating business needs into customer desired outcomes and features
Look across the enterprise to assess downstream impacts and create an integrated experience for our people
Build relationships, influence, and lead various cross-functional business gain alignment to deliver amazing products
Work closely with our HR COE Partners to create employee experiences leveraging process, technology, or enablement that drive execution and adoption while providing continuous feedback to the stakeholders on product effectiveness
Partner across IT teams to drive agile mindset and practice shift, developing and executing against the tech roadmap, grooming and prioritizing the product backlog, sprint planning and UAT



What We’re Looking For:


Minimum 5+ years product management experience in HR, Talent, employee experience, (customer service-related projects would be a plus)
Proven ability to thrive in ambiguous environments, break down ambiguity into patterns and create operational rigor
Excellent communication, problem solving, creative solutions, active listening & time management
Experience with solutions involving Workday, Payroll, Talent Management, chatbots
Ability to communicate to a wide spectrum of cross-functional team members, including technical and business resources and influence
Executive presence including ability to lead and influence without direct authority
Proven ability to build collaborative relationships at all levels and ensuring teams create a collaborative culture
Proven self-starter with demonstrated problem solving and organizational skills
Bachelors or advanced degree in a relevant field such as human computer interaction, computer science, marketing, business or related field or equivalent work experience



This position is not eligible for relocation assistance.

At Pinterest we believe the workplace should be equitable, inclusive, and inspiring for every employee. In an effort to provide greater transparency, we are sharing the base salary range for this position. The position is also eligible for equity. Final salary is based on a number of factors including location, travel, relevant prior experience, or particular skills and expertise.

Title: Director, Product Management
Description:
Our client, a cutting-edge technology company, is seeking a highly skilled Director of Product Management to lead their innovative product development efforts. This role presents an exciting opportunity to drive product strategy, enhance market competitiveness, and deliver exceptional value to customers. If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for technology and a track record of success in product management leadership, we encourage you to apply for this key leadership position.

Ideal Candidate:


Strategic Vision: Develops and executes product strategies aligned with business goals, driving growth and market expansion.
Leadership Skills: Provides strong leadership and guidance to the product management team, fostering a culture of collaboration and innovation.
Market Insight: Demonstrates a deep understanding of market trends, customer needs, and competitive landscape, informing product development decisions.
Product Expertise: Possesses strong technical acumen and expertise in product management methodologies, with experience leading complex, cross-functional projects.
Customer Focus: Champions customer-centricity, ensuring that product decisions are driven by customer insights and feedback.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborates effectively with cross-functional teams, including engineering, marketing, sales, and customer support, to deliver successful product launches and enhancements.
Problem Solver: Identifies challenges and opportunities, facilitating problem-solving discussions to drive solutions and overcome obstacles.
Communication Skills: Communicates product vision, strategy, and roadmap effectively to stakeholders at all levels, gaining alignment and support.
Adaptability: Adapts to changing market conditions and customer requirements, leading through change with resilience and agility.
Results-Driven: Sets clear goals and objectives, measures performance against key metrics, and drives continuous improvement to achieve business outcomes.


Primary Duties:


Product Strategy: Develops and executes product strategies to drive business growth and enhance market competitiveness.
Team Leadership: Provides leadership and guidance to the product management team, setting clear goals and expectations, and fostering a culture of collaboration and innovation.
Market Analysis: Conducts market research and analysis to identify market trends, customer needs, and competitive landscape, informing product decisions.
Product Roadmap: Develops and maintains product roadmaps, prioritizing features and enhancements based on customer feedback, market trends, and business objectives.
Product Development: Works closely with engineering teams to define product requirements, manage product development lifecycles, and ensure timely delivery of high-quality products.
Go-to-Market Strategy: Collaborates with marketing, sales, and customer support teams to develop go-to-market strategies, positioning, and messaging for product launches and enhancements.
Customer Engagement: Engages with customers to gather feedback, understand pain points, and validate product ideas, ensuring that product decisions are driven by customer insights.
Performance Tracking: Defines key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track product performance, measures progress against goals, and drives continuous improvement initiatives.
Stakeholder Management: Builds and maintains relationships with internal and external stakeholders, gaining alignment and support for product initiatives.
Budget Management: Manages product budgets, ensuring efficient allocation of resources to maximize ROI and achieve business objectives.


Minimum Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
Minimum of 8 years of experience in product management roles, with at least 3 years in a leadership capacity.
Proven track record of success in developing and launching successful products in a technology-driven environment.
Strong leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficiency in product management tools and methodologies.


Work Conditions:


Office-based role with occasional travel to client sites, industry events, and conferences.
Flexible work hours may be required to accommodate project deadlines and international time zones.

Title: VP Product Management, Platform
Description:
Hims & Hers Health, Inc. (better known as Hims & Hers) is the leading health and wellness platform, on a mission to help the world feel great through the power of better health. We are revolutionizing telehealth for providers and their patients alike. Making personalized solutions accessible is of paramount importance to Hims & Hers and we are focused on continued innovation in this space. Hims & Hers offers nonprescription products and access to highly personalized prescription solutions for a variety of conditions related to mental health, sexual health, hair care, skincare, heart health, and more.

Hims & Hers is a public company, traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol “HIMS”. To learn more about the brand and offerings, you can visit hims.com and forhers.com , or visit our investor site . For information on the company’s outstanding benefits, culture, and its talent-first flexible/remote work approach, see below and visit www.hims.com/careers-professionals .

About The Role

Hims and Hers is redefining wellness and healthcare with a fully integrated consumer, clinician, and pharmacy experience designed for the way consumers want to be treated today. As Vice President of Product Management on the Platform team, you will collaborate with leadership and functional partners to build innovative experiences and products for Hims & Hers customers. These platforms will power a seamless experience for our customers, clinicians and operations. We’re looking for platform innovators who can help transform the way wellness and healthcare are delivered.

You Will


Lead a team through the ideation, technical development, and launch of innovative features and products and platforms. You’ll build and manage multiple product lines focused on our Electronic Medical Records, Fulfillment, and backend solutions
Impact focused. You and your team will develop innovative scalable platform experiences for our customers, clinicians, and fulfillment teams to build the next generation of telemedicine that touches every part of the company across digital and physical products
Recruit, mentor, and develop a high-performing product management team, including leaders/managers
Consolidate feedback from marketing, analytics, business operations, medical teams, fulfillment, and technical stakeholders to develop products and engagement channels with millions of consumers. You’ll use that feedback to build scalable platforms and product solutions that can drive long-term sustainable growth for the business and our customers
Manage long-term product development lifecycles, including customer insights & market analysis, roadmaps and prioritization frameworks, KPIs, and product delivery
Drive product development with a team of engineers, designers, analysts, clinicians, CX, and fulfillment teams
Establish data-backed shared vision across the company by building consensus on priorities leading to product execution
Integrate company strategy, research and market analysis into product strategy, and collaborate with your team to deliver product lines and user experiences based on that strategy. Define and analyze metrics that inform the success of product lines.
Maximize efficiency in a fast growing company with a constantly evolving environment


You Have:


12+ years of experience in Product Management, working collaboratively with engineering and design teams
5+ years of experience hiring, managing, and developing both individual contributors and senior leaders / managers
You have a track record of building scaled platform solutions that touch millions of customers a year
Comfortable leading work and strategy on complex technical products across digital and physical product domains from our data platform, to how we fulfill orders in our warehouses with our pharmacy solutions
Experience presenting to senior executive audiences and executing against feedback. You’ve successfully used data to drive decisions and change viewpoints with those executive stakeholders


Our Benefits (there are more but here are some highlights):


Competitive salary & equity compensation for full-time roles
Unlimited PTO, company holidays, and quarterly mental health days
Comprehensive health benefits including medical, dental & vision, and parental leave
Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)
Employee discounts on hims & hers & Apostrophe online products
401k benefits with employer matching contribution
Offsite team retreats

Title: SVP, Product Management
Description:
Company Summary:

We are a value-based, precision medicine company specializing in solutions for providers, patients, life science and EMS companies. With the emergence of value-based care, Integra Connect’s mission is to help specialty care providers succeed both clinically and financially. We accomplish this through a comprehensive offering of technology and services, unified by our cloud-based platform, combined with unmatched industry expertise. We are looking for like-minded individuals committed to making a difference in healthcare. Come join our growing team!







Job Description:

The Senior Vice President (SVP), Product Management will be a seasoned data product leader in the precision oncology space, tasked to drive the strategic definition and evolution of IntegraConnect’s product offerings across all disciplines. The SVP is responsible for developing long-term product roadmaps and driving the successful execution and go to market for technology solutions that enable consumers to unlock insights for improved clinical, operational and financial performance. This will be a hands-on position taking an active role in the day-to-day product management of Integra Connect’s products and applications, most notably our data platform. You will coordinate with cross-functional teams including sales, account management, marketing, engineering, regulatory/compliance, etc. to deliver growth, profitability, client retention and support dependent Integra business units.




Responsibilities:

Completely own the Product Management Function for all Integra Connect Products
Develop and communicate a comprehensive vision, define and develop the product road map, and articulate the short-term and long-term strategy for the entirety of the product management function, ensuring alignment with the company’s mission to win through data insights.
Ensure products and the product team’s execution aligns with the organization’s strategic vision focused on growth and financial performance.
Be hands on with day-to-day product management activities related to products and applications with a heavy focus on Integra’s data platform.
Stay up to date on industry trends, anticipate future market needs, and stay ahead of our competition via the creation of cutting-edge products.
Work with Data Science teams to incorporate and maximize the use of AI to enhance product functionality.
Lead collaboration across multiple disciplines (including software developers, informaticists, medical SMEs, clinical operations and senior leadership) to take the product from inception to market.
Analyzes proposed product concepts and product development programs; prepares return-on-investment analyses; establishes time schedules with operations.
Lead and manage a team of high performing product managers through the product lifecycle and development processes, while instituting and driving mature product management discipline and process adherence.
Lead Data Curation Team
Effectively manage team performance, morale, budgets, and skill sets.
Develop product management talent and link business objectives to the team’s quarterly and annual objectives and key results.
Ability to build trusting relationships across teams and establish a clear product vision for both internal and external consumption.
Establishes a comprehensive understanding of the market with an understanding of how to win against competition and identify/leverage partnerships.
Identifies cross organizational opportunities to leverage scale, efficiency, and execution.
Define, prioritize, and execute a flow of product enhancements and operational improvements designed to enhance revenue and improve ROI.




Qualifications:

BA/BS required, MBA (or equivalent) preferred. Clinical degree (BSN, RPh, etc.) and background a plus.
10 years progressive Product Management experience in healthcare IT and services with Oncology experience is a must.
Demonstrated track record of bringing multiple product and cross functional teams together to create a strong, cohesive, and collaborative product organization united in one vision.
Demonstrated track record of delivering successful, market-leading products on time and on budget.
Strong understanding of all facets of bringing product to market, including market analysis, product market fit, positioning strategy, MVPs/prototypes, design thinking, go to market strategy, pricing, testing, etc.
Ability to connect effectively and constructively with clients and sales teams to understand and articulate marketplace needs, and to communicate our product capabilities and differentiators.
Subject matter expert in Electronic Health Records, Patient Portal, data ingestion/onboarding/transformation/enrichment/abstraction, and/or Care Management
Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to influence without authority.
PC proficiency including advanced PowerPoint, Excel and SFDC experience.
Familiarity with relevant data and standards: Clinical, lab, genomics, pathways, claims, financial from FHIR, SMART on FHIR, HL7, CCD/CDA, etc.
Expertise in processing clinical, operational and financial data from health providers through an end-to-end data pipeline (e.g., connectivity, data ingestion, normalization, transformation, enrichment, abstraction, etc.




Benefits:

Integra Connect, LLC provides a comprehensive benefits plan.

Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance beginning the 1st of the month following your date of hire
Paid Time Off
401k with employer match
Paid Holidays and Floating Holiday

Equal Opportunity Employer

Important Notice:

At Integra Connect, we are committed to providing a safe and secure environment for our job applicants. Unfortunately, scammers may attempt to impersonate our company to deceive individuals seeking employment. We take this matter seriously and want to ensure your job search with us is free from any fraudulent activity.

Integra Connect has become aware of recent, fraudulent recruitment activity being conducted by individuals or groups who claim to be third party recruiters and/or points of contact for our Company. Examples include sending candidates a request for personal information, conducting online interviews or meetings, making offers of employment, demanding money for employment related services and activities, or asking the applicant to purchase a laptop or other work-related equipment for the job. The aim of the fraud is to obtain personally identifying information (e.g., identity theft) and/or money. The Company’s name, as well as the names of employees, are used to try to convey authenticity.

Here are some tips to help you identify and avoid job scams:

1. Always Check the Source:

Ensure that the job listing is on our official website or a reputable job board. Our official domain is https://www.integraconnect.com/resources/careers/. Be cautious of unsolicited emails, text messages, or social media messages offering job opportunities.

2. Be Wary of Requests for Personal Information:

We will never request sensitive personal information like your Social Security number, bank details, or payment for onboarding/equipment. If you encounter such requests, it's likely a scam.

3. Verify Contact Information:

Check that the contact information provided in the job posting, including email addresses and phone numbers, aligns with our official contact information. Scammers often use generic or non-company email addresses.

What is the sender’s email address? Is it consistent with other job postings from this company? Email addresses that are slightly different from any business’s primary contact information (Jane.Doe@IntegraConnect.org vs John.Doe@Integra Connect.com) are a common warning sign.
If you are contacted through LinkedIn, be sure to review the entire profile to verify their credentials.

If you suspect that a job offer is fraudulent, we recommend that you do not respond to it.

If you believe you are the victim of any fraudulent activity, you can report it to the appropriate authorities at https://www.myfloridalegal.com/consumer-protection/how-to-protect-yourself-job-listing-and-job-search-firms (Florida Department of State) and/or https://consumer.ftc.gov/articles/job-scams#report (U.S. Federal Trade Commission).

Integra Connect is not responsible for any fraudulent offers and advises prospective candidates to follow the guidance provided above.

Thank you for your interest in a career with Integra Connect. We look forward to connecting with genuine, talented individuals like you.

Title: VP of Product
Description:
Overview:

BizzyCar is looking for a VP of Product Management, reporting to the CEO, who will be responsible for strategizing, developing, delivering and executing on BizzyCar’s Product Roadmap and Vision. This person will deliver business value to new and existing customers by enhancing existing products and developing net-new products.

As the VP of Product Management, you will lead the team in translation of customer / prospect needs and industry trends into product and feature deployments. In our growing product function, you will foster data-driven product strategy, build efficient team processes, and drive thought leadership while working to coach, grow and develop each member of your team.

Responsibilities


Build and manage product roadmaps, priorities and iterative processes while working cross-functionally to incorporate feedback from both internal and external stakeholders, as well as supporting data
Work with cross-functional teams via our software development lifecycle process to oversee the ongoing development, optimization and timely commercialization of our software solutions
Ensure business requirements are documented and reflected in product roadmaps and in the resulting products
Develop and execute a plan to enhance products, improve customer experience, and boost operational efficiency using Artificial Intelligence
Establish the AI product roadmap in collaboration with cross-functional teams, such as engineering, core research, and customer success. Implement AI-related features and functionalities across various products and services according to priorities
Focus on the continued refinement of agile methodology and processes
Motivate and lead a high performing product team by aligning the group's goals with the organization's strategies
Cultivate a results-driven culture
Represent the company at industry events and with prospects, clients, investors and business partners
Stay current on automotive industry trends and develop innovative and breakthrough solutions that challenge the status quo
Establish and implement a highly effective product development and product prioritization process rooted in regular communication with stakeholders
Defining and Establishing metrics around product planning and feature releases to measure the performance of new and established features


Requirements

Qualifications


At least 8 years of experience as a product owner or product manager in a SaaS environment
At least 3 years of experience leading a product team in building SaaS products from concept to implementation
Extensive expertise in all levels of product life-cycle from product requirements gathering, design, planning, acceptance test plans, deployment, and iteration
Track record of developing market leading products with experience defining or owning a product area
Track record of building a high-performance product management team
Extensive experience in product development & technology in real estate and/or building operations
Familiar with Data Science, Machine Learning, and Artificial Intelligence
Exceptional analytical skills, i.e the ability to assemble and interpret data, create executive summaries, and deliver actionable business insights
Ability to weigh competing priorities, manage tradeoffs and evaluate opportunistic new ideas with stakeholders, driving to consensus while maintaining a clear focus on overarching business priorities
Experience working in a start-up environment -- you must be adept at working in a fast-paced environment and have shown yourself to be adaptive and flexible
Highly-proactive, self-starter capable of effectively managing several projects
Hands-on product management experience and demonstrated history of being a team player, and desire to jump in and get your hands dirty as needed - in other words you must be an effective leader and a strong individual contributor
Superior communication skills -- ability to prioritize, and efficiently and transparently communicate at a team, executive, and company level
Automotive Retail and Manufacturing experience is not required, but will be given additional consideration (car dealerships and OEM’s)


Benefits

BENEFITS

We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by our competitive compensation and benefits package including paid time off, medical, dental, and vision benefits and future growth opportunities within the company. Plus, we work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning and culture. To learn more about our company please visit: www.BizzyCar.com.

ABOUT BizzyCar

BizzyCar is a B2B SaaS company that develops software for automotive dealers in the United States. We are on a mission to improve the customer experience when it comes to automotive care for consumers by creating elegant solutions that allow consumers to get their cars repaired without ever leaving home or work. BizzyCar is a fast paced environment where we solve complex problems in tight deadlines. We are a dispersed team but get together quarterly in person to maintain a tight company culture. Established leadership team has experience growing high value companies in short time periods and rewarding employees with equity returns and well paying jobs.

Title: Director, Product
Description:
Description

About EasyKnock

EasyKnock is the country’s first home equity solutions platform. Our innovative programs give homeowners flexible, quick solutions for their financial needs. Whether paying off debt, purchasing a new home, or funding a business, EasyKnock empowers homeowners to convert their equity to cash without strict lender qualifications through our suite of offerings, including our leading sale-leaseback solution. Customers sell their homes to us and remain as renters while working toward their goals. We’re passionate about helping American homeowners access the equity they’ve built up in their homes by giving them back liquidity, flexibility, and control.

Position Description

EasyKnock, the nation's pioneering home equity solutions platform, is seeking a Product Director to join our dynamic and rapidly growing product team. Our programs empower homeowners with innovative financial solutions by leveraging the equity in their homes. As a Product Director at EasyKnock, you'll play a vital role in leading the development and expansion of our data-driven Equity Unlock products and services.

In this pivotal role, you'll lead the growth of our portfolio of complex, cutting-edge equity unlock products. Your efforts will power multiple customer and business-facing processes, expanding our comprehensive customer view and providing valuable insights that drive strategic decisions across the company.

As part of our close-knit team, you'll have the opportunity to tackle unexplored problem spaces, brainstorm innovative solutions, collaborate with various internal stakeholders, and work with external partners to enhance our integrations, decision engines, and customer insight infrastructure. This is the place for you if you thrive in creating from scratch and painting a compelling vision for real estate equity products.

Roles & Responsibilities


Manage the product roadmap for the portfolio of Equity Unlock offerings, aiming to boost transparency and efficiencies across the business
Prioritize next-generation products based on internal stakeholder feedback, customer input, and industry trends
Collaborate cross-functionally with software engineering, UX, Underwriting/Risk Marketing and other internal stakeholders to launch tests, optimize offerings and improve the customer onboarding experience



Requirements


Minimum of 5-7 years of Product Management experience
Proven ability to act decisively and execute efficiently across a portfolio
Exceptional communication and listening skills, with the ability to articulate complex problems to both technical and non-technical audiences
Strong stakeholder management skills, with proven ability to influence internal and external stakeholders, negotiate timelines, and navigate complex situations
A track record of successfully managing a portfolio of products, launching new features and capabilities, preferably from inception with limited resources with a focus on Customer Outcomes
Experience or certifications in the real estate or financial services industry preferred
Startup experience is preferred, given the high degree of ambiguity and responsibility inherent in the role



Benefits


Remote-friendly environment or hybrid-friendly (2 days per week in office) if you live near our offices in the NYC, DC or Seattle area
Competitive base salary commensurate with experience and geographic location. Range: $160,000 - $190,000
Bonus eligible position
Full benefits and unlimited PTO
Generous stock options
Opportunity to be part of a fast-growing company in the financial technology industry

Title: Director of Product Management
Description:
Summary

We are currently growing our Smart Energy (ISE) team and are seeking a self-driving product manager with the business acumen to help drive the growth and shape the future of a collaborative, high performance, growth-oriented business unit.

About this opportunity:

We are looking for a passionate and results-oriented manager to be part of our Global Advanced Technology Solutions organization. The Director, Product Management will drive and support the growth and performance of the ISE business by enabling best practices in Offering Management, Market Opportunity Identification/Validation, and Product Definition/Development.

The Energy market is complex and evolving, and customer requirements are ever-changing. We're seeking a highly motivated and savvy business leader to build high performing teams and influence stakeholders to attain and grow multiple accounts across the energy ecosystem. Critical activities and abilities will include developing specific market strategies and leading the extended organization to develop products and service offerings in support of the Smart Energy strategy.

This role is a prime development opportunity for those interested in developing their entrepreneurial and business skills, while shaping the future of a high-growth business unit.

Detailed Description

Define the power product portfolio for strategic growth & profit, in alignment with SE strategy.
Develop product and service offering positioning, differentiation, and value propositions, along with go-to-market strategies.
Developing market requirements and new product proposals for the Project Approval Process for new product introduction.
Work with stakeholders to execute strategy deployment.
Work with all functions and suppliers to drive product development timeless.
Advise channel activities such as new product launches and promotions/events.
Analyze market size/growth, technology trends, channel and customer segment needs.
Understand competitors and identify strengths/weaknesses/opportunities/threats.
Conduct market evaluation and analysis; understand/evaluate customer buying behaviors.
Actively lead Voice of Customer activities and insight-gathering process.
Contribute to SPP/AOP planning processes through business case development.
Build relationships with strategic customers; serve as a key customer account interface.
Direct engagement with customers and trade associations at executive levels to expand business engagements.
Development of high-performing, entrepreneurial global account and commercial team, including direct, matrix, and indirect reports.

Knowledge/Skills/Competencies

Specific, proven experience with energy and/or power conversion products, notably variable frequency drives, inverters, EV chargers, and/or battery management systems.
Strong technical background within market management, product management or product development required.
In-depth experience and proven skills in financial modeling and analysis.
Strong communication, interpersonal, relationship management and business development skills.
Strong business-to-business analytical, financial, strategic thinking and marketing skills.
Self-motivated with the ability to simultaneously manage multiple time-sensitive tasks.
Demonstrated problem-solving ability to quickly learn new skills, and global mindset.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
External focus/product launch experience/experience with customer sales or support.
Success in managing through influence and persuasion in high-matrix structure.
Must be able to successfully operate in a team environment.
Ability to thrive in fast-paced, results-driven organization.
Working knowledge of operations, including manufacturing processes, schedules and scheduling requirements, supply chain, product development project management, logistics and product delivery methods.

Physical Demands

Duties of this position are performed in a normal office environment or manufacturing floor
Likely there will be a significant amount of travel between customer and Celestica locations
Duties may require extended periods of sitting and sustained visual concentration on a computer monitor or on numbers and other detailed data.
Repetitive manual movements (e.g., data entry, using a computer mouse, using a calculator, etc.) are frequently required.
Above demands are carried out within the local existing Health and Safety guidelines

Typical Experience

8 years of experience in Market and/or Product Management. Of those 8 years, at least 3 years managing direct reports.
Industry/Market: Specific, proven experience with energy and/or power conversion products, notably energy generation, energy storage, or distribution systems. Industry recognition and participation in industry alliances desired.

Typical Education

Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Industrial Management
Educational Requirements may vary by Geography

Notes

This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities of the position. Employees are held accountable for all duties of the job. Job duties and the % of time identified for any function are subject to change at any time.

The salary range described in this posting is an estimate by the Company, and may change based on several factors, including by not limited to a change in the duties covered by the job posting, or the credentials, experience or geographic jurisdiction of the successful candidate. Salary Range: $156k-$244k Annually

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.




Celestica’s policy on equal employment opportunity prohibits discrimination based on race, color, creed, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran or disability status, or other characteristics protected by law.

This policy applies to hiring, promotion, discharge, pay, fringe benefits, job training, classification, referral and other aspects of employment and also states that retaliation against a person who files a charge of discrimination, participates in a discrimination proceeding, or otherwise opposes an unlawful employment practice will not be tolerated. All information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Location: This is a remote position, with travel as necessary. We are open to considering candidates close to any of our US locations in Massachusetts, Pennsylvania, Minnesota, Texas, Arizona, Oregon or California as well as locations near major airports such as the Northeast, Southeast, Midwest and Pacific Coast.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:

Celestica (NYSE, TSX: CLS) enables the world’s best brands. Through our recognized customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in Aerospace and Defense, Communications, Enterprise, HealthTech, Industrial, Capital Equipment and Energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges. As a leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions, Celestica brings global expertise and insight at every stage of product development – from drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services for products from advanced medical devices, to highly engineered aviation systems, to next-generation hardware platform solutions for the Cloud. Headquartered in Toronto, with talented teams spanning 40+ locations in 13 countries across the Americas, Europe and Asia, we imagine, develop and deliver a better future with our customers.
